meaningMnemonic: When your <kanji>eye</kanji> is on the <kanji>target</kanji> you know your <vocabulary>purpose</vocabulary>. You also have your eye on the <vocabulary>goal</vocabulary> (that's the target, after all!).
readingMnemonic: The reading is a reading for 目 that's abnormal. You've seen this reading with 目標 and 目次, though, so hopefully it won't be too hard at this point. Just imagine telling someone your 目的, only to have them laugh in your face and begin <reading>mock</reading>ing もく you for it. Now you're not so sure if your goal is going to work.
